intro: Phyteuma orbiculare var. pratense, commonly known as the meadow phyteuma, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, moist soil. This species is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
